manager_types.description: Controls project flow to nudge developers into unethical decisions
manager_types.behavior: Encourages ignoring privacy concerns for business goals
tactics: Manipulates project timelines to force rushed decisions
Downplays ethical concerns in favor of business objectives

manager_types.description: Designs work processes to limit ethical choices
manager_types.behavior: Makes ethical alternatives difficult for developers to implement
tactics: Creates technical debt that makes ethical solutions harder
Sets up project constraints that favor unethical approaches

manager_types.description: Hides ethical concerns in bureaucracy or misleading language
manager_types.behavior: Frames unethical decisions as 'user-friendly' or 'business as usual'
tactics: Uses euphemisms to mask ethical issues
Reframes ethical problems as technical challenges

manager_types.description: Uses fear-based pressure to push unethical decisions
manager_types.behavior: Pushes developers by claiming 'everyone in the industry does this'
tactics: Uses industry trends to justify unethical practices

manager_types.description: Constantly pressures developers to prioritize business over ethics
manager_types.behavior: Micromanages and keeps repeating business objectives until the developer complies
tactics: Frequent check-ins focused on business metrics

manager_types.description: Weakens ethical concerns by making them seem less important
manager_types.behavior: Reframes ethical issues as minor inconveniences rather than serious concerns
tactics: Minimizes the impact of ethical issues

manager_types.description: Rationalizes decisions to fit company goals rather than ethics
manager_types.behavior: Uses misleading statistics or industry trends to justify questionable actions
tactics: Cherry-picks data to support unethical decisions

manager_types.description: Frames unethical actions as normal in industry practice
manager_types.behavior: Claims 'other companies do it' to push unethical solutions

manager_types.description: Uses emotional reasoning to justify unethical actions
manager_types.behavior: Says developers should 'care about the company' instead of users

manager_types.description: Recognizes ethical concerns but does not act
manager_types.behavior: Expresses discomfort with unethical choices but follows orders

manager_types.description: Believes ethical concerns are na√Øve and business must come first
manager_types.behavior: Says 'this is just how the industry works' to justify unethical decisions

manager_types.description: Creates workarounds to reach business goals while pretending to care about ethics
manager_types.behavior: Proposes half-measures instead of actual ethical solutions

manager_types.description: Follows persuasive design rules to justify decisions
manager_types.behavior: Uses legal loopholes to bypass ethical issues
tactics: Follows letter but not spirit of rules

manager_types.description: Prioritizes business and shareholder interests over ethics
manager_types.behavior: Claims maximizing profits is more important than ethical concerns

manager_types.description: Fully supports business goals with no regard for ethics
manager_types.behavior: Pressures developers to comply with business objectives at all costs
